DOCNAME: S.O., A.K. AND Ar.K. v. TURKEY
TEXT: The CARDINAL applicants , S.Ö , PERSON and Ar . PERSON are NORP citizens of NORP origin , resident in GPE They are members of PERSON Pırgıç NORP PERSON ( the ORG ) , a hospital founded by NORP in GPE . Before the ORG , the applicants are represented by Mr PERSON and Mr Setrak NORP , lawyers practising in GPE .
The facts of the present case , as submitted by the applicants , may be summarised as follows .

ORG , who had been a patient at the ORG , made her will in DATE and bequeathed her real estate to the ORG . On DATE ORG of ORG held that the ORG was a “ community foundation ” whose charter had been definitively established in DATE . They also recalled that such foundations were only entitled to enter into transactions prescribed in their founding charter . Accordingly , ORG held that the foundation in question could not acquire property bequeathed to it by will given that the founding charter did not specify such a right .

Consequently , shortly before her death in DATE , ORG sold her CARDINAL shops in GPE to the first CARDINAL applicants PERSON , PERSON and GPE . K , who are members of the ORG and donated the proceeds of this transaction to the ORG .

On DATE , the ORG instituted civil proceedings against the applicants in ORG . The ORG declared to be sole beneficiary of ORG estate under LAW of LAW , which provides that the estate of a deceased person shall pass to the ORG if the person dies intestate and has no relatives . The ORG also maintained that the sales contract between the first CARDINAL applicants and PERSON had been signed under false pretences . It alleged that ORG intention in entering into the contract was to donate her real estate to the foundation during her lifetime through the sale of her property to GPE , PERSON and GPE . K , who are members of the foundation . Accordingly , it requested the court to order that the shops , which had been transferred under the sales contract , be restored and that the donation to the ORG be revoked .

On DATE ORG rejected the ORG ’s request on the ground that the ORG ’s claim of being the sole beneficiary of the PERSON estate required clarification . On DATE ORG quashed this judgment on the ground that the first - instance court should have adjourned the case for the ORG to prove that it had a legal right over ORG estate . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ request for rectification of this decision .
On DATE ORG applied the decision of DATE and decided to adjourn the case for the ORG to prove that it was entitled to pursue it .

Later , the ORG submitted to the court a certificate of inheritance issued by ORG dated DATE to the effect that the ORG was the true beneficiary of the estate as ORG sister had predeceased her and that PERSON had no other living relatives . Accordingly , ORG decided to examine the merits of the case . After examining the expert report , the court stated that although there was a difference between the real value of the estate and the amount stated in the sales contract , this was not in itself sufficient to conclude that the applicants had acted under false pretences . Consequently , on DATE , the court dismissed the case on the ground that the ORG had failed to provide sufficient evidence in support of its claims .

On DATE ORG quashed this judgment . Referring to the will signed on DATE and the expert report , which stated that there was a significant difference between the real value of the estates and the amount paid to ORG , ORG found that the first instance court had sufficient evidence before it to give a decision .
On DATE the ORG request for rectification of this decision was rejected by ORG .

On DATE ORG applied the decision of ORG . The court found that the sales contract had been signed under false pretences and accordingly annulled it . Consequently it decided that the shops in issue be included in ORG estate . The court dismissed the remainder of the case .
On DATE ORG once again quashed the decision of the first - instance court . It held that ORG should have accepted the ORG ’s claims as a whole .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ request for rectification of this decision .
On DATE ORG applied the decision of ORG . It decided that the will signed on DATE and the donation made to the foundation should be annulled .
On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of the first - instance court .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ request for rectification .
